title: Forestry Settings Schema
description: Todo item sent by the client

new_page_extension.title: New file format
new_page_extension.description:
New files created in Forestry can be Markdown or HTM

For example: HERE WE GO

admin_path.title: Admin Path
admin_path.description: The folder where you store the Forestry admin file.

webhook_url.title: Webhook URL
webhook_url.description: Forestry can send events to a webhook (ie. post_import, post_publish)

upload_dir.title: Upload Directory
upload_dir.description: The directory where media is stored inside of git

public_path.title: Public Path
public_path.description: The path where media is served from

use_front_matter_path.title: Use Front Matter Path
use_front_matter_path.description: Override the public path for front matter fields.

file_template.title: File Path
file_template.description:
The path where media will be uploaded and served from.

Available variables: :filename:, :year:, :month:, :day:.

build.title: Webhook URL
build.description: Forestry can send events to a webhook (ie. post_import, post_publish)

install_dependencies_command.title: Install Dependencies Command
install_dependencies_command.description: The command that installs your project dependencies, if necessary. The results of this command will be cached for faster startup times.

preview_docker_image.title: Preview Docker Image
preview_docker_image.description: Path to a publicly available image on Docker hub

mount_path.title: Mount Path
mount_path.description: The directory inside the docker container where your site should be mounted.

working_dir.title: Working Directory
working_dir.description: Override the default working directory of the docker image

instant_preview_command.title: Build Command
instant_preview_command.description: The command that starts your static site generator's dev server.

sections.title: Webhook URL
sections.description: Forestry can send events to a webhook (ie. post_import, post_publish)
